definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to spoil one's appetite/fig. to get fed up with sth
to one's taste/tasty/fig. sth one enjoys
(coll.) to keep sb in suspense/to tantalize/to keep on tenterhooks

sentences.english: Do not blame your food ause you have no appetite。
sentences.chinese: 不要因为你自己没有胃口而去责备你的食物。

sentences.english: They rivalled one another in their appetites .
I am sure this food will whet their appetites.
sentences.chinese: 我敢肯定，这些菜能让他们大开胃口。

sentences.english: Local media are covering every aspect of the scare with a voracious appetite.
sentences.chinese: 当地媒体正在用贪婪的胃口报道这一恐慌的每一方面。

sentences.english: The odoriferous spices stimulated her jaded appetite.
sentences.chinese: 香料的芬芳刺激她疲惫的胃口。

sentences.english: Particular kind of fragrant crisp varieties, the most to my appetite.
sentences.chinese: 特别是那种又香又脆的品种，最合我的胃口。

sentences.english: But I have no appetite, unless it is a basket of "Prawn Dumpling (Ha Gao in Cantonese)."
sentences.chinese: 可是我热得没胃口，除非蒸熟的是一笼虾饺。

sentences.english: I think it whets our appetite for the next things to come.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得我们的胃口接下来磨砺的东西。

sentences.english: Old but I feel it is to eat up tantalize .
sentences.chinese: 但是我老感觉吃起来很是吊胃口。

sentences.english: People sometimes bite off more than they can chew.
sentences.chinese: 有时人们胃口太大，眼高手低。

sentences.english: The volumes and the appetite for transactions appeared endless.
sentences.chinese: 股票交易量和交易的胃口似乎无穷尽。

sentences.english: Tilapia is especially well-suited to American tastes.
sentences.chinese: 罗非鱼特别适合美国人的胃口。

sentences.english: She always let you eat it with her to eat it, completely ignoring how bad your appetite.
sentences.chinese: 她总是让你陪她吃这吃那，全然不顾你的胃口有多糟。

sentences.english: Sour-sweet fish agreed very well with him.
Lao Yus citation has ignited the infinite spite of his favorites appetite.
sentences.chinese: 老俞的引用点燃了他宠物胃口的无限怨恨。

definition: to one's taste/tasty/fig. sth one enjoys
to like/fond of/to prefer/to love/one's tastes/preference
dishes with generous amounts of meat and fish/lavish meal
to feed to the full/to cram
